  2. Must have the roles, i.e., SUS_SCT_AI_Reporting_Assistant_Manager & SUS_SCT_AI_Reporting_Assistant_Viewer

ESG Data Imported into Sustainability Control Tower

 

For instance, I have created a template named "ESG Report Template for Calcination & Power"  to generate an ESG report for the above imported data using the AI application.

ESG Report Template for Calcination & Power Business Lines

 

let us use the "Create"  option to set-up a tailored custom template for ESG metrics and reference facts.  For Instance, I have added sections and subsections to align with the ESG pillars to have the template structure. We can rename, remove the sections and subsections at any point of time.

Sections and Subsections of ESG report

 

Now, let us start filling the sections with the content. To add the text to the "carbon emissions profile" , I have built the content by adding "Reference Facts" and " Metrics". We can add maximum 30 facts for each section or subsection.

Pillar: Environment

We can choose the "Reference facts" from the predefined facts, and metrics can be chosen from the available SAP provided quantitative metrics. The text  in this section will be generated by AI (Artificial Intelligence) for the metrics defined in the "Manage Metrics App".

Assignment of Reference Facts & Metrics to generate text for the Carbon Emissions Profile

 

Now, let us use the option " Generate" to preview the content for the above assigned reference facts and metrics.

 

AI generated text for the Carbon Emissions Profile

 

Now, let us generate charts for the "Carbon Emissions Profile". 

 

 

Following the successful assignment of the charts, use the option "Generate" charts for each metric.

 

AI generated graph for the GHG Emissions by GHG Scope & Business Locations

 

AI generated graph for the GHG Emissions by Business Country

 

AI generated graph for the Location & Market based Emissions

 

Now, let us create tables to fill out emissions metrics details by leveraging AI. Use the option " Add Table" to assign the required metrics tables.

For Instance, I have chosen two tables to represent  GHG Emissions (CO2e) & GHG Emissions Reduction Targets (CO2e).

 

 

Following the successful addition of the tables, use the option "Generate" to fill out the details for the selected table.

AI generated table for Scope-1 Emissions

 

AI generated table for Scope-2 & Scope-3 Emissions

 

In a similar manner, let us assign the reference facts and metrics to generate text , charts and tables for the "Energy Profile" under "Environmental" pillar.

 

AI generated text for the Energy Profile

 

AI generated tables for the Energy Profile

 

In a similar manner, let us assign the reference facts and metrics to generate text , charts and tables for the "Water Profile" under "Environmental" pillar.

 

AI generated text for the Water Profile

 

AI generated chart for Water Usage by Business Country

 

  AI generated chart for Water Usage Over Time

 

Pillar: Social

In a similar manner, let us assign the reference facts and metrics to generate text , charts and tables for the "Health & Safety" under the "Social" pillar.

 

AI generated text for the Health & Safety facts

 

AI generated graph for the work related incidents & fatalities

 

Pillar: Governance

In a similar manner, let us assign the reference facts and metrics to generate text , charts and tables for the "Governance Body" under the "Governance" pillar.

 

AI generated text for the governance body metrics

 

AI generated graph for the metric share of the women in management

 

AI generated graph for the Anti-Corruption Incidents metrics

 

Following the successful setup of the sections and subsections for the ESG reporting content, let us take a look at the configured report content preview. Let us use the option "Preview" to understand the structure of the ESG report.

 

 

Now, let us generate the ESG report  using the tailored custom template. 

 

Once the details have been provided to generate the report using the tailored custom template,  select the "Generate Report" option.

 

While the ESG report is being generated, system displays the progress of the report.

 

Once the system generates the report, its status is updated as "Completed".

Let us select the option "Download" to view the ESG report in Pdf format.

The ESG report has been downloaded in .pdf format.

 

 

Here we go....

AI generated ESG report - SAP SCT

 

 

😊 This brings me to the end of the process walk-through of the creation of the custom ESG template and AI usage to generate tailored ESG report for a specific sustainability reporting year. I hope my blog proves useful to the sustainability team. I look forward to leveraging AI capabilities at scale to strengthen ESG reporting structures.

 

--

Yours Sincerely,

Pardhasaradhi Reddy.C

entry.title: Exploring SAP Generative AI SDK: Python, JavaScript, and Java Libraries 🎁
entry.content:
SAP's Generative AI SDK offers powerful tools for integrating AI capabilities into your business applications.

This blog will guide you through the libraries available for Python, JavaScript, and Java, and how to use them effectively.

1.🔵 SAP Generative AI SDK for Python

The SAP Generative AI SDK for Python allows developers to leverage generative models from the SAP AI Core. This SDK supports models from providers like OpenAI, Amazon, and Google, and integrates with LangChain for enhanced functionality.

Documentation and Examples : https://help.sap.com/doc/generative-ai-hub-sdk/CLOUD/en-US/index.html 

Installation: To install the SDK, use the following command:

pip install sap-ai-sdk-gen[all]

You can also install specific model providers:

pip install "sap-ai-sdk-gen[google, amazon]"

Configuration: Set up your environment variables or configuration file to authenticate and connect to SAP AI Core:

export AICORE_CLIENT_ID="your_client_id"
export AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET="your_client_secret"
export AICORE_AUTH_URL="your_auth_url"
export AICORE_BASE_URL="your_base_url"

Usage: Here's a simple example to generate text using the OpenAI model:

from sap_ai_sdk_gen import OpenAI

client = OpenAI()
response = client.generate_text(prompt="Hello, world!")
print(response)

2.🔵 SAP Generative AI SDK for JavaScript

The JavaScript SDK enables Node.js applications to interact with SAP AI Core, providing seamless integration with generative models.

https://github.com/SAP/ai-sdk-js 

Installation: Install the SDK via npm:

npm install -ai-sdk/ai-api

Configuration: Ensure your environment variables are set up correctly:

export AICORE_CLIENT_ID="your_client_id"
export AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET="your_client_secret"
export AICORE_AUTH_URL="your_auth_url"
export AICORE_BASE_URL="your_base_url"

Usage: Here's a basic example to generate text:

import { OpenAI } from '@sap-ai-sdk/ai-api';

const client = new OpenAI();
client.generateText('Hello, world!').then(response => {
  console.log(response);
});

3.🔵 SAP Generative AI SDK for Java

The Java SDK integrates AI capabilities into Java-based applications, leveraging the SAP AI Core's generative models.

https://github.com/SAP/ai-sdk-java

Installation: Add the SDK to your Maven project:

 

<dependency>
  <groupId>com.sap.ai</groupId>
  <artifactId>sap-ai-sdk</artifactId>
  <version>5.6.0</version>
</dependency>

 

Configuration: Configure your application properties:

aicore.client.id=your_client_id
aicore.client.secret=your_client_secret
aicore.auth.url=your_auth_url
aicore.base.url=your_base_url

Usage: Here's an example to generate text:

import com.sap.ai.sdk.OpenAI;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        OpenAI client = new OpenAI();
        String response = client.generateText("Hello, world!");
        System.out.println(response);
    }
}

Conclusion

SAP's Generative AI SDKs for Python, JavaScript, and Java provide robust tools for integrating AI into your applications. By following the installation, configuration, and usage examples provided, you can start leveraging the power of generative AI in your projects.

Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or need further assistance! Happy coding!

entry.title: Securing Agentic AI Through Threat Modeling at SAP
entry.content:
By Helen Oakley, Senior Director of Software and AI Security, SAP Global Security & Cloud Compliance 

This year, at SAP Sapphire, SAP unveiled its expanded vision for Business AI, introducing a growing network of Joule Agents that work across systems and lines of business. This marks a clear step into the era of Agentic AI – systems that can understand context, take initiative, and drive outcomes autonomously. “SAP combines the world’s most powerful suite of business applications with uniquely rich data and the latest AI innovations to create a flywheel of customer value,” said CEO Christian Klein. While this evolution opens exciting possibilities for automation and productivity, it also introduces a new layer of complexity in how we approach security. Agentic systems challenge traditional safeguards, making it essential to identify and mitigate risks early through tailored threat modeling. 

At its core, threat modeling is about asking the right questions early in the development process, while the system is still being designed and built. Rather than simply looking for bugs or code flaws, it forces us to think through how a system might behave in the real world. What could go wrong if an agent’s goals are manipulated? Could someone poison its memory over time? What if an agent uses a tool in an unintended or unsafe way? How could agent-generated content be used to mislead or overload human decision-makers? What happens when agents collaborate or collide in ways that expose the system to cascading failures or manipulation? 

These are not hypothetical questions. They reflect the real and emerging risks of agentic systems. The OWASP Agentic AI Threats & Mitigations Guide is a valuable resource that brings structure to this thinking. It highlights specific threats such as memory poisoning, cascading hallucinations, privilege compromise, and agent communication poisoning. For teams building these systems, it helps provide a common vocabulary and practical examples to guide threat modeling work. 

To give an example of how threat modeling helps in practice, let’s take the case of goal manipulation – one of the emerging risks identified in the OWASP guide. In agentic systems, attackers don’t necessarily need to exploit traditional software flaws. Instead, they can attempt to influence an agent’s behavior over time by subtly manipulating its objectives. This might happen through indirect prompt injection, compromised data sources, or crafted tool responses. Imagine an agent responsible for prioritizing financial transactions; if adversarial inputs gradually shift its decision logic, it could start approving risky payments outside of the intended policy. In threat modeling exercises, we explore how such scenarios could play out by analyzing how the agent forms and updates its goals, how memory and feedback loops could reinforce undesired behaviors, and how downstream actions might be impacted. This helps define targeted mitigations, such as isolating goal-setting logic from external inputs, monitoring shifts in agent behavior, and adding human validation for sensitive decisions. 

The OWASP Agentic AI Threats & Mitigations Guide provides a helpful reference architecture that illustrates where these types of risks can emerge. The diagram below maps threats to key components in a typical agentic system, making it easier to visualize how threat modeling applies in practice. 

Image Source: OWASP Agentic AI Threats and Mitigations guide, “Threat Model Summary” 

At SAP, threat modeling has long been part of our Secure Software Development and Operations Lifecycle (Secure SDOL), which is certified under ISO 27001. This framework ensures security is built into every phase of the product lifecycle, from design to operations. With Agentic AI, we are expanding our threat modeling approach to address risks that don’t typically appear in traditional application security. This includes analyzing agent memory behavior, reasoning patterns, system autonomy, human interaction points, and the dynamics of multi-agent ecosystems. The focus shifts from identifying static vulnerabilities to understanding how autonomy and learning can lead to unintended behaviors. From there, we define appropriate controls and mitigations to reduce those risks. 

The field of Agentic AI security continues to take shape. Standards like ISO 42001 and regulations such as the EU AI Act are in development, and industry best practices are actively maturing. That’s why collaboration is essential. SAP is contributing to the conversations held with industry groups focused on these challenges, including OWASP GenAI initiatives. We’re not just adopting ideas, we’re helping shape them, working with peers and regulators to advance the state of AI security. Our teams bring deep expertise in both enterprise security and AI systems, offering a perspective that’s helping guide how the broader ecosystem approaches agentic risks. 

Transparency remains central to how SAP approaches product security. As we continue evolving our work with AI, we’re committed to sharing what we learn through resources like the SAP Trust Center. Security is not a one-time effort. It is a continuous process, especially with systems as dynamic as Agentic AI. 

Threat modeling helps us stay ahead of these evolving risks and supports the design of systems that are both capable and safe. As Agentic AI becomes more embedded in enterprise workflows, this kind of proactive thinking becomes essential. 

SAP is proud to contribute to shaping the future of secure AI. By collaborating across the industry and applying deep expertise from our teams, we’re helping advance practical, forward-looking approaches to securing the next generation of intelligent systems.

entry.title: Purchase Pilot でフリーテキスト発注を AI 変革 — SAP BTP Hackathon 2025 成果レポート
entry.content:
2025 年春、SAP ジャパン の有志メンバーで結成したチーム 「TO BEs」 は、SAP BTP Hackathon 2025 に参加し、 本ハッカソンの公式テーマ「SAP業務にAIでSurpriseを！それ、AIに任せません？」のもと、社内で“もし自分たちが現場でソリューションを構築するとしたら？”というエキシビションとして挑戦しました。

本記事は、その成果として開発した Purchase Pilot の概要と技術アーキテクチャ、およびデモをまとめたレポートです。SAP Community の皆さんからのフィードバックを楽しみにしています！

 

背景 — フリーテキスト発注が生む 3 つの課題

SAP S/4HANA などの購買業務では、品目マスタが存在しない場合に「テキスト発注」が使われます。しかしこの運用には、以下のような問題がつきまといます。

  1. 業務負荷の増大 — 項目を 1 行ずつ入力・確認する手間。
  2. データ品質の低下 — 記述ゆれや入力ミスで KPI が組めない。
  3. 意思決定の遅延 — 精度の低い実績データが経営判断を鈍らせる。

私たちは、この “曖昧で非定型” な領域こそ AI が真価を発揮する余地だと考えました。

 

ソリューション — Purchase Pilot とは？

迷わず・ミスなく・効率的に。

Purchase Pilot は、現場担当者がテキスト発注を入力する際に AI がリアルタイムで支援 するツールです。コア機能は次の 2 つです。

 

仕組み — 2 つのコア機能を深掘り

1. インテリジェントな入力補完 — 処理フロー

ざっくり 3 ステップで完結します。

  1. 過去レコードをベクトルとして準備
    - 過去の正確なテキスト発注レコードを抽出し、Short Text をベクトル化して Vector Engine へ保存。
  2. 類似レコード × Few‑shot
    - マニュアル入力された Short Text をベクトル化し、類似度検索でトップ 3 件を取得。
  3. 意味情報を加えて補完
    - S/4HANA Cloud からコストセンタ名など “意味テキスト” を取得。
    - LLM が Few‑shot とフィールド定義情報を基に各必要項目を推定し、UI 上で提案。

Few‑shot とは、過去レコードを "お手本" として数件渡すことで、LLM により正確な出力を促す手法です。

 

2. リアルタイムな異常検知 — 処理フロー

流れは次の 4 ステップです。

  1. 過去レコードをベクトルとして準備
    - 過去の正確なテキスト発注レコードを抽出し、Short Text をベクトル化して Vector Engine へ保存。
  2. 品目グループ・発注単位を推定
    - マニュアル入力された Short Text をベクトル化し、類似度検索でトップ 3 件を取得。
    - Few‑shot とフィールド定義情報を組み合わせて、LLM が品目グループと発注単位を推定。
  3. レンジを計算
    - 推定した品目グループをキーに S/4HANA Cloud へ問い合わせ、過去レコードから単価・個数レンジを動的に算出。
  4. 異常を判定 & 警告
    - 入力された単価・個数がレンジ外なら即警告。ユーザーは確認モーダル経由で上書き確定も可能。

 

ソリューションアーキテクチャ

* 印はハッカソン時点では未実装のコンポーネントです。

アーキテクチャ図のポイント

  • SAP BTP Cloud Foundry 上に CAP アプリ (Node.js/Python) を配置し、SAP HANA Cloud と SAP AI Core/Gen AI Hub をサービスブローカー経由で統合。
  • Embedding 処理でテキストをベクトル化し、HANA Cloud の Vector Engine に保存・検索。
  • フロントエンドは SAP Build Work Zone にデプロイされた Fiori Elements アプリとして提供。
  • オンプレ SAP S/4HANA とは Cloud Connector で安全にトンネリングし、購買伝票やマスタを連携。（*は PoC では未接続）
  • SAP Cloud Solutions（S/4HANA Cloud, Ariba など）とも同じ OData/SAP BTP 接続モデルで拡張可能。

 

デモ動画 — “5 分入力” が “数十秒” に短縮

動画の流れ

  1. SAP GUI で従来のフリーテキスト発注
    -  マニュアルでのテキスト発注入力は、操作に慣れたユーザでも約 5 分ほどの時間を要し、いくつかの入力ミスが発生します。
  2. Purchase Pilot - 自動補完機能の実演
    - Recommend ボタンをクリックすると、テキストから勘定コード・単位・コストセンタなどを自動補完します。
  3. Purchase Pilot - 異常検知機能の実演
    - 手入力した伝票に対して Validate ボタンを押すと、AI が不足項目や異常値を即時指摘し、修正アドバイスを提示します。

このソリューションにより、入力時間の削減 や 入力ミスの軽減 を実現することができます！また、異常をリアルタイム検知することで、手戻りがゼロ になり、クリーンなデータによる経営指標を高速更新に繋がります！

 

まとめ

  • SAP ジャパン チーム TO BEs の挑戦: 社員視点で “現場 DX” をテーマに、AI × BTP の可能性を検証
  • Purchase Pilot の価値: テキスト発注という "最後の手入力領域" を AI で変革し、操作性とデータ品質を同時に向上。

ご意見をお聞かせください！ コメント欄や SNS でのフィードバックをお待ちしています。

entry.title: The Value of SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) in The Context of Business Steering
entry.content:
This blog post is a joint work of @Nektarios_Vasileiou33 and @BlazZabukovec .

Picture 1: SAP Analytics Cloud demo story example - Dashboard design by Daniel Davis

 

MOTIVATION

In today's fast-paced business world, the ability to effectively steer and lead an organisation is fundamental for achieving strategic goals and maintaining a competitive edge. A key success criterion is the capacity to fully harness and derive value from organisational data. Many companies struggle with data problems, such as fragmented information, outdated systems, and the super important task of preparing data for emerging technologies like AI. Recognising these challenges, we are excited to introduce a blog series dedicated to showcasing the substantial business value of SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) in the context of planning and analytics.

The motivation behind this initiative is to provide a comprehensive exploration of how SAP BDC capabilities as essential instruments, facilitating robust strategic alignment and guiding effective decision-making processes across diverse organisational requirements. We aim to illustrate how SAP BDC, equipped with powerful data management, planning, analytics and innovative AI capabilities, empowers organisations with enhanced business steering agility by providing real-time insights, streamlined data management, and automated decision support – going from insights to action, helps mainly leaders guide their businesses with precision.

Our blog series will provide valuable insights for decision-makers seeking to harness SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) to enhance operational efficiency, optimise resource allocation, and achieve long-term objectives. By featuring detailed planning & analytics topics, the series will illustrate the transformative impact of SAP BDC in addressing the operational complexities of today’s business environment. This first introductory blog post will spotlight the strategic advantages of SAP BDC, particularly in the context of Business Steering, setting the stage for a deeper exploration of its benefits throughout the blog series.

There are several blog posts in the series that will cover advantages of SAP BDC in the context of business steering, so please stay tuned for the upcoming blogs:

  1. The value of SAP BDC in the context of business steering (THIS BLOG POST)

  2. Is AI going to “retire” a dashboard?

  3. Simulations, a game changer in today’s volatile world

  4. Planning & Analysis in the context of SAP BDC

  5. Move BPC and BW-IP into SAP BDC

  6. Real-time steering with LIVE planning

  7. PaPM use cases

  8. Self – service analytics and real time business steering

  9. Business steering powered by AI agents

  10. Leverage data products in the context of planning & forecasting

  11. Introducing AI/ML capabilities by SAP Databricks

 

CHALLENGES

The current global market situation is characterised by heightened volatility and uncertainty, driven by factors such as geopolitical tensions, inflationary pressures and rapid technological advancements. In this dynamic environment businesses face significant challenges like supply chain disruptions, rising and uncontrolled operational costs and the need for digital transformation to remain competitive.

Obviously, there is no one-size-fits-all solution to every challenge, but adopting a data-driven decision-making process provides significant advantages that can help organizations navigate complexities and respond more effectively to market dynamics. By relying on data to drive decisions, businesses can achieve greater accuracy and insight, which helps in identifying trends, understanding customer behaviours, and optimising operations. This approach enables companies to be more agile and responsive to changing conditions.

Every leader today feels the weight of growing complexity. CFOs balancing growth and profitability. CHROs managing talent in an evolving workforce. CIOs modernising IT while keeping innovation alive.

Picture 2: Challenges by CXO persona

But the true challenge lies in how these functions are increasingly interconnected. When one part of the business is disrupted, whether it’s a supply chain issue or a talent gap, the ripple effects are felt everywhere. To succeed, businesses need more than solutions for individual challenges, businesses need a way to align every function and unlock collective power.

Like Aristotle (apparently) once said: “THE WHOLE IS GREATER THAN THE SUM OF ITS PARTS”

Today’s complexity demands more than incremental fixes and silo apps/solutions. If we want to have benefits from AI and systems of agents collaborating across all functions, we need to have a solid foundation, where we can seamlessly combine applications, data, insights and AI into one ecosystem.

Just picture this example around Financial Planning (incl. forecasting & simulation), where we can develop a comprehensive financial snapshot while automating workflow tasks through agentic AI.

Picture 3: Forecasting & Simulation use case evolution

This is where we bring together all relevant data, like revenues, expenses, also across different scenarios, like actuals, plan & forecast. We also integrate all relevant external data, like different macro-economic KPIs, external market research data., etc. Based on identified key drivers/influencers of our business, we are going to define and perform different planning/forecasting scenarios. In the next step we are going to simulate and analyse impact of external drivers like inflation rate on our performance and identify the areas that will be impacted. Specialised analytics agent can propose potential mitigation strategies, like targeted promotions to drive customer demand, that can be further assessed & analysed. Based on this information we can decide for a certain course of actions that can be triggered by system of agents.

Picture 4: Risk analysis & mitigation strategies delivered by agentic AI

We can say with great confidence that our customers are not working in the area of visualising their data and that’s why SAP is also not in the business of visualising our customer’s data (even though we can do this is in a great way), but we are in a business of enabling the “Insights to Action” framework which is exactly what I have illustrated in the use case around financial planning powered by agentic AI.

Organizations striving to make data-driven decisions and a proper, also AI powered jump from insights to action, encounter several significant challenges. One major obstacle is seamlessly integrating data across various systems to extract valuable business insights. Additionally, ensuring data quality and integrity is crucial to maintaining trust in the decision-making process. Furthermore, building a comprehensive data foundation is essential for supporting the deployment of AI-based applications. Addressing these challenges requires robust data management strategies and innovative solutions to harness the full potential of data for valuable decision-making.

 

SAP's STRATEGY

To tackle these challenges, SAP developed the SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) to provide cloud services that empower organizations in navigating the complexities of data management and business steering process. SAP BDC serves as a unified platform, providing the necessary agility for effective business steering. SAP BDC offers a semantically rich, unified data environment that enhances operational efficiency and strategic decision-making capabilities. By centralising key business data from SAP and non-SAP sources into a unified semantic layer, SAP BDC unlocks insights, advanced analytics, and AI capabilities, empowering businesses to drive intelligent growth and innovation.

Picture 5: SAP Business Suite

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) is a fully managed Software as a Service (SaaS) solution that unifies and governs all SAP data while seamlessly connecting with third-party data. The solution combines the capabilities of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Business Warehouse, along with managed SAP Databricks. SAP BDC includes curated business-ready data products from SAP line of business applications leveraged by business-ready Intelligent Applications providing line-of-business leaders the context needed to make impactful decisions.

Picture 6: High level overview of SAP BDC services

Key Components of SAP Business Data Cloud:

SAP Datasphere: As the foundational element of SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Datasphere provides a streamlined environment for data integration, warehousing, and governance. It features flexible integrated data tiering—comprising object, disk-based, and in-memory storage—ensuring a cost-effective persistence layer. Additionally, it offers sophisticated tools for analytical data modeling, transformation, and integration, enabling organizations to extract valuable insights and foster business innovation. Users can also utilize the framework to develop their own data products.

SAP Analytics Cloud: This component delivers cutting-edge analytics and planning capabilities while providing real-time insights powered by AI and machine learning. It integrates seamlessly with SAP Datasphere to offer a unified data analysis experience.

SAP Databricks: Through SAP's partnership with Databricks, data science capabilities are significantly enhanced. This collaboration facilitates advanced analytics and data science operations on both SAP and non-SAP data. Key features include ML Flows for machine learning operations, Mosaic AI for model training and serving, and Notebooks equipped with coding assistants and visualizations. The serverless Spark offerings aim to simplify big data processing, while replication-free access to SAP data products and integration with the Unity Catalogue further enrich the experience.

Intelligent Applications and Data Products: SAP Business Data Cloud emphasizes Intelligent Applications and SAP-managed Data Products. These ready-to-use, standardized business data objects and applications are managed by SAP, reducing the effort needed to build and operate analytical and data science applications. They promote data consistency and reusability, serving as modular, reusable assets for analytical models or AI/ML and planning workflows.

Unified Semantic Layer: Central to SAP Business Data Cloud is the unified semantic model, which standardizes data definitions across SAP and non-SAP systems. It offers simplified zero-copy data access via a standardized delta-share interface, supporting cross-domain analytics and AI applications. Additionally, it features a centralized cross-application catalog for data products and Intelligent Applications.

SAP BW: is integrated into SAP BDC, allowing SAP BW objects to be onboarded as data products. The SAP BW data products can be integrated in SAP Databricks to enable advanced analytics and data science use cases.

 

BUSINESS VALUE

SAP BDC delivers significant business value in the context of business steering, particularly within planning and analytics use cases. 

Enhanced Decision-Making: SAP BDC revolutionises decision-making by providing real-time access to integrated data. This SAP Analytics Cloud capability ensures that business leaders receive accurate and immediate insights, empowering them to make informed and strategic decisions. With this enhanced decision-making capacity, organizations can effectively anticipate market trends, adjust their strategies in response to evolving conditions, and maintain a competitive edge in their respective industries.

Comprehensive Data Integration: At the heart of SAP BDC is its ability to seamlessly integrate data from multiple sources, both SAP and non-SAP systems. This integration creates a unified view of the organisation's data landscape, supporting precise planning and predictive forecasting. By breaking down data silos and ensuring a holistic perspective, SAP BDC enables businesses to gain comprehensive insights into their operations and make well-rounded decisions. The data holistic perspective is fundamental for organizations to unleash AI across the entire data ecosystem.

Scalable Analytics and Planning Capabilities: One of the standout features of SAP BDC is its scalable analytics and planning capabilities. It allows businesses to conduct extensive analyses and simulations, uncovering valuable insights that aid in tailoring forecasts to specific scenarios. Whether it's understanding customer behavior or predicting market shifts, SAP Analytics Cloud robust analytics and planning capabilities in combination with SAP Databricks empower organizations to make data-driven predictions with unmatched precision and confidence.

Improved Efficiency and Agility: SAP BDC streamlines data integration and analytics processes, significantly enhancing efficiency and agility within organizations. By automating these crucial processes, leveraging data management features in SAP Datasphere, analytics in SAP Analytics Cloud and AI/ML workflows in SAP Databricks, it cuts down the time and effort needed for data preparation and analysis (replication free access of data and zero-copy). This efficiency allows teams to redirect their focus from operational concerns to strategic steering, driving more meaningful business results in less time.

Facilitated Innovation: Leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as artificial intelligence and machine learning, SAP BDC promotes innovation within organizations. Its cloud-based infrastructure ensures that businesses have access to the latest advancements, encouraging the exploration of new and innovative business models. This focus on facilitated innovation helps companies remain at the forefront of industry trends and continuously evolve their offerings.

Consistency in Data Governance: Ensuring data integrity and consistency is a critical component of SAP BDC's value proposition. The platform offers comprehensive data governance and quality management, providing reliable data integrity across planning and analytics activities. With consistent data definitions and governance, businesses can achieve accurate reporting and foster alignment across various departments, leading to cohesive planning strategies.

Seamless Collaboration: SAP BDC enhances collaboration by centralising data accessibility and sharing. Data Cataloguing, Data Sharing and Collaboration capabilities foster improved teamwork among departments and enables synchronised planning efforts and a guided steering process. With shared insights and aligned goals, teams can work together more effectively, driving unified strategies and achieving common objectives that benefit the entire organisation.

Strategic Resource Allocation: Through its predictive analytics and planning capabilities SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Databricks, SAP BDC enables organizations to allocate resources more strategically. By delivering actionable insights, businesses can optimize operations, improve resource allocation, and enhance overall performance. This strategic approach ensures that resources are used efficiently to achieve maximum impact, driving profound business success.

Future-Proofing Autonomous Business Steering: By harnessing SAP AI agents within the trusted SAP BDC data foundation, the planning and business steering process is transformed from a static, periodic exercise into a dynamic, proactive function. These AI-driven insights empower companies to swiftly assess the potential impacts of various strategic options and make decisive actions. This approach allows businesses to anticipate market changes and respond efficiently, making strategic adjustments with confidence and precision.

 

CONCLUSION

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) stands as a vital tool for organisations striving to enhance their decision-making capabilities, align strategic objectives, and navigate the complexities of modern business landscapes. In the era of AI, organizations require scalable and efficient data architectures to manage growing volumes of data and extract actionable insights leveraging advanced analytics, planning and machine learning capabilities. As we embark on this informative blog series, we invite you to stay tuned for our upcoming posts, where we will delve deeper into the AI, Planning & Analytics functionalities associated with SAP BDC and business steering use cases. Gain insights into how this powerful platform can drive your business forward, optimise operations, and help you achieve your strategic goals with confidence. Join us in exploring the transformative potential of SAP BDC and discover how it can be the catalyst for your organisation's growth and success.

 

CALL TO ACTION

To deepen your understanding of SAP Business Data Cloud, we invite you to explore the following links:

SAP Business Data Cloud Help

https://help.sap.com/docs/business-data-cloud?locale=en-US

Introducing SAP Business Data Cloud

https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/leveraging-sap-analytics-cloud-functionality-for-enterprise-planning/introducing-sap-business-data-cloud

Positioning SAP Business Data Cloud

https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/positioning-sap-business-data-cloud-1

entry.title: Simplifying Field Service with AI in SAP FSM
entry.content:
Introduction:

SAP field service management operations set up for any new company settings requires careful planning, which has become much easier with the help of built in cloud AI features. With the help of these smart tools companies in FSM helps with much better decision making. Which also helps the technicians to complete their work more efficiently since they will be getting real-time support, faster & for instance access to the information which they require and smart scheduling. This results in lesser delays, and much improved service quality.

 Prerequisites for SAP Cloud FSM:

  • Must have a valid license for SAP AI Units.
  • Premium AI features must be activated in FSM tenant.
  • Sufficient Historical Data (1000 activities with the execution Stage should be equal to CLOSE status in order to train the system)


Key AI Features in SAP FSM:

Below is the breakdown of the core AI functionalities available

1. Intelligent Filtering

  1. Assignment Duration Prediction
  2. Activity Summary
  3. Equipment Summary

 

-> Intelligent Filtering:

Intelligent Filtering will help by showing the most relevant technicians only for the job and automatically sorting. which is like having a smart assistant that understands the input. Instead of checking each customer manually system will sort them based on the requirements of the job, then you will be getting a list of customers who passed the requirements which leads to lesser time consumption and better accuracy.
For example, imagine you're a dispatcher in FSM who is trying to assign a technician to a service job, you have list of technicians, but not all of them are suitable for all tasks, some might be far away, some might not be having the right skills, and others might already busy with other service jobs assigned previously. so based on the below points we can perform the intelligent filtering.

  • What the job needs (Like skills, tools, etc.)
  • Which technicians are available to perform the service task
  • Who is nearby to perform the service task
  • Who has done the similar job well previously.

Why It’s Useful:

  • Lesser time consumption: No need to manually check the list of all customers.
  • Reduced errors: Selects only technicians who are qualified and are available.
  • Improved customer service: Faster and better matches which results in the quicker resolutions for the tasks.


Steps to Enable:

  1. Raise an Incident:
    • Go to your SAP support portal.
    • Create a request under the component: CEC-SRV-FSM-AI.
    • Mention that you have a valid license and want to activate Intelligent Filtering.
  2. SAP Will Enable the Feature:
    • Once the request is processed, SAP will activate the feature in your FSM environment.
  3. Verify in the FSM Portal:
    • Navigate to the Planning & Dispatching module.
    • You’ll see technician suggestions ranked intelligently when assigning service calls.

Compared to the older Best Matching Technician plugin, Intelligent Filtering is smarter and much easier to use. The old plugin works based on business rules which has been set up for every company, like checking technician skills or distance. whereas Intelligent Filtering in FSM uses the AI to understand what exactly dispatcher is looking for in the technicians and it automatically suggests the best technicians available for the service task.  It is much faster, that means it supports natural language searches. And it also gives the extra insights like past equipment history (which is not available in the old plugin doesn’t offer).


-> Assignment Duration Prediction:

Assignment Duration Prediction can be seen during the dispatching of an activity which will provide the overview like how long it will take to complete the current service task, which technician will be suitable for this activity rather than dispatcher guessing how long it might take to complete the current service tasks.

It uses the data like below:

  • The type of service task which needs to be assigned
  • The technician’s past performance on the service tasks
  • Historical data which are similar to the current service task
  • Job priority and some other requirements

This will help the dispatchers to plan accurately and helps to avoid the delay.

 Why It’s Useful:

  •  Better scheduling: can avoid the overloading the technicians.
  • Lesser delays during the assignment of service tasks.

Steps to Enable:

  1. Training the (AI Model) system

You can do this in two easy ways:

  • Option A: Use the Settings Screen
    • Go to Settings and Configuration in FSM.
    • Click on Assignment Duration Prediction.
    • Select your training data and click Train.

 

  • Option B: Use a Sample Business Rule
    • Download the sample rule from SAP Help.
    • Upload it to your FSM system.
    • Add your technical contact and adjust the date range if needed.
    • Run the rule to train the model.
  1. Activate the Feature
  • Go to: Settings and Configuration → Planning and Dispatching → General Settings → Activity Planning → Additional Settings
  • Turn on the checkbox:
    “Allow assignment duration prediction for semi and fully automated scheduling”
  1. Start Using It
  • Use features like Auto-Scheduling or Best Matching Technician.
  • The system will now use predicted durations instead of planned ones when assigning jobs.

 

-> Activity Summary:

Activity summary is like an assistant who give you the overview of the activity like what technician was doing, it gives you the summarized explanation of activity in detail, it helps the dispatcher to understand the below points:

  • what types of jobs were completed by technicians?
  • how much time did they take to complete the activity?
  • Did any issue occur during the completion of activity?


Why It’s Useful:

  • with the help of activity summary dispatcher can save time as he doesn't have to go through each and every activity
  • Dispatcher can quickly understand how team is performing the activity using this feature
  • Can quickly identify if there is any issue which is occurring multiple times
  • Better decisions could be made with the help of summaries


 Steps to Enable

  1. Raise a Support Request
    • Go to the SAP Support Portal
    • Create a request under the component: CEC-SRV-FSM-AI
    • Mention that you want to enable Activity Summary along with other features.
  2. SAP Will Enable the Feature
    • Once approved, SAP will activate it in your FSM system
  3. Check in the FSM Portal
    • Go to the Planning and Dispatching module
    • You’ll see AI-generated summaries for completed jobs

 

-> Equipment Summary:

Equipment Summary is similar to activity summary where in the activity summary we will be getting the summary of the completed activity but in the equipment summary we will be getting the summary of the equipment which will be used in the service tasks. it provides the details of the equipment which will be used in the service tasks which will help the dispatcher to make better decisions like.

  • Dispatcher can see which equipment was used for which service activity
  • how often did technician used this equipment
  • if there is any issue related to this equipment that can be seen in the equipment summary along with that, we can also see the performance of the equipment over time

Why It’s Useful:

  • it saves time by giving the summary of the equipment in an instance rather than going through the equipment history record
  • if there is any reoccurring issue that can be fixed with the help of this feature so it will be very useful for preventive maintenance activities


Steps to Enable:

  1. Go to Planning and Dispatching - Open the Planning and Dispatching module in FSM.
  2. Open a Service Call you can either click on a service call from the Dispatching Board or select one from the Service Calls list.
  3. Generate Equipment Summary
    • Inside the service call, go to the General Information tab.
    • Scroll down to the Insights section.
    • Click the button to generate the equipment summary.
  4. Review and Use the Summary
    • The system will show a short, AI-generated summary of the equipment’s history.

 

 

Conclusion:

SAP FSM’s AI features help the service teams to work much faster and smarter by reducing the manual effort and better decision making.

entry.title: AI-driven, Joule-enabled Warehouse Resource & Operations Management for SAP EWM on S/4 HANA 2023
entry.content:
It is a topic in every warehouse: Supervisors and Warehouse Operations Managers would like to see their planned workload for the day and see in real-time whether shipping times will be met. If shipping times are in jeopardy, the warehouse system is then expected to evaluate if an optimized resource allocation could pro-actively solve any potential delays. When a more optimal usage of the available resources is found, resources should automatically be directed to the critical areas. Being able to take action proactively is of the essence, because we do not want to only take action when we are already in delay.

The following is an example of an AI-driven, Joule enabled Application that can accomplish the above outlined requirements and activities supported by AI. The Application leverages the embedded AI in the EWM Private Cloud Edition S/4 HANA 2023 FPS03 release and the Joule Studio available in SAP Build.

 

 

The Architecture of the Application looks as follows:

 

AI-based Warehouse Workload Visibility

In the current version of the Application, the expected workloads of picking and packing operations are calculated leveraging the embedded AI capabilities in SAP EWM, which are then displayed in the UI5 Application (see in the example below):

It is also clearly visible in which Activity Area the workload is currently exceeding the planned Resource capacity.

The Application then further allows a manual simulation of adding or removing Resources to evaluate the impact in a given activity area. 

The fully "automatic rebalancing" function evaluates whether it is possible to optimize the resource allocation to the different areas, considering the allowed resource types in an Activity Area.

If an optimized resource allocation is possible, the warehouse operations manager, can accept these changes and the resources will be reassigned in the EWM system so that they will receive workload to execute from the new area.

Joule-enabled with custom EWM Joule Skills

Further more the current version of the Application provides Joule support for Warehouse Operations Management with the following Joule Skills:

- Joule Skill 1: Current Workload Analysis: Provide a comprehensive analysis of the current workload associated with picking and packing operations, considering the current resource allocation across different warehouse areas, as well as dependent scheduling of packing activities.
- Joule Skill 2: Provide Optimized Resource Allocation: Simulate an optimal workforce allocation strategy to mitigate bottlenecks and criticalities within the warehouse operations, to avoid shipping delays.
- Joule Skill 3: Accept Optimized Resource Allocation: Accept the optimization results and reassign the resources in EWM to the new areas.   

Coming soon an AI Agent will be introduce that autonomously orchestrates workforce allocation (monitored by the supervisor).

For more Information on this Application & AI functionality please contact SAP Services (EWMServices@sap.com).
